Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2013 01:56AM Brooklyn wrote: Hi Violinfingers :) I do not often post (more of a lurker) but wanted to let you know that I am on TDM-1 currently and have received one treatment and am due to get my second one tomorrow! It has been a very manageable chemo for me so far and I actually feel better than I have in a long time! I have a lot of my energy back and do not even feel like I need a nap in the middle of the day (and with two small boys that is a good thing!) I also live in ohio and am pretty sure you will be going to the cancer center I go to because I think they may be the only ones in ohio offering the trial... (if so it is a wonderful place!) I started the trial last October but was randomized into the physicians choice portion and put on Navelbine and Herceptin which was effective for only a few months... since starting on TDM-1 three weeks ago the large palpable skull met on the back of my head can hardly be felt at all!!!! So I am very encouraged that it is doing its job! I sincerely hope that TDM-1 works for you and gets your cancer under control! Thanks for starting this thread as I am also interested in hearing about others experiences on this drug... good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Anyone on T-DM1? violinfingers Pbjarrett

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2013 05:20AM Brooklyn wrote: Yes...that is the same place I go to! And it really is a great place with wonderful people :) hope you make the trip feeling well and then feeling even better after your treatment! My doctor has a lady on the study who has been on it two and a half years and doing great! There is hope!
Posts.Title: Anyone on T-DM1? violinfingers Pbjarrett

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2014 03:50PM Brooklyn wrote: I have shingles too!!! That is crazy! Mine are on the back of my neck and are incredibly painful! :( I felt like they came out of no where and at first I thought I had a skin infection so I didn't get started on antivirals as early as I should have so the pain got kind of out of control but it is much better now. I hope yours clear quickly... I've had it for 3 weeks and still have scabs! It's definately something to watch for when immunosuppressed... Just one more thing! Feel better soon!!
Posts.Title: At first I thought it was skin mets... Fitztwins DivineMrsM

Posts.Title: Anyone have problems getting insurance to approve Perjeta? Brooklyn MiracleMileM

Posts.Content: Brooklyn wrote: Hi everyone! :) I was supposed to do Perjeta, Herceptin, and weekly Taxol 3 and a half years ago but my insurance denied it and so I went onto TDM1/Kadcyla and until a few weeks ago was NED. A new spot was found in my hip andSo my doctor decided that Perjeta is the way to go now but my insurance is again denying it... He is having a peer to peer review with them tomorrow... I Wondered if anyone else has had an issue with insurance approving Perjeta? Thank you!! Dx 7/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone have problems getting insurance to approve Perjeta? Brooklyn MiracleMileM

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2014 06:52PM Brooklyn wrote: Hi Trish03 :) I have been on TDM-1 since January of 2013 and I have found that it has been very manageable! I had bone mets only when I started it and I have been NED since the third treatment (scans coming up again next week) I feel fine the day I have treatment (I get it every 3 weeks) and there are no pre meds. I am tired for about the next two-three days with nausea on and off but zofran takes care of the nausea and the tiredness is usually helped by going to bed a little early... I rarely have to take a nap and it really doesn't affect my schedule. I have a 4 and 6 year old and I am fine to run after them. I have never had a problem with low platelets or neuropathy. Dry mouth is a pain but start on Biotene right away, it makes a big difference. I hope you do well on it! Let me know if you have any other questions!
Posts.Title: Who's on Kadcyla/TDM1? Trish03 Denny123

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2015 02:50PM Brooklyn wrote: Hi everyone! I have been on Kadcyla for 2 and a half years!! I have been NED since cycle two when it cleared up some pretty severe bone mets! Mild fatigue, nausea, and dry mouth are my main side effects for a few days after treatment but it's a lot easier than traditional chemo! Hoping for great long term results for everyone!

Posts.Title: how long did kadcyla (tdm1) work for you? debsing Travelingpants2

Posts.Content: Brooklyn wrote: Hi to everyone, I don't post often but I am at a loss and am needing advice from people who truly understand... I found out yesterday that after 3 years on kadcyla I have progression to my Sacrum and Femurs... It's a feeling I had finally pushed to the back of my mind, that feeling of fear and sadness, when you hear it's moved on again. I will be starting a new treatment of taxol and perjeta after getting radiation. This will be my 5th treatment course in 5 and a half years and all I can hear is one of my infusion nurses telling me that once people get to their 5th and 6th treatments they start going through them like water and it doesn't take long before they are gone ðŸ˜ž She told me that about a year ago and I have never forgotten it because I knew my next treatment course would be my 5th... I feel like nothing is going to help now... Has anyone else been told this about treatment courses after their 3rd or 4th ones??? I'm just so sad, I have two little boys and want to stay around to watch them grow but her statement gives me little hope... Thanks in advance all of you ladies are so strong and amazing Dx 7/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Progression and nurses statement have me freaked out!! Help! Brooklyn Brooklyn

Thank you ladies from the bottom of my heart
